etymology.description: 先(先) (xiān, "first; previous") + 辈(輩) (bèi, "generation; lifetime")
etymology.interpretation: The term 先輩(先辈) (xiānbèi, "forebears") combines 先(先) (xiān, "first; previous") to indicate those who have come before or earlier, with 辈(輩) (bèi, "generation; lifetime") referring to people from an earlier generation. Together, it denotes ancestors or forebears, emphasizing respect for those who preceded us.

examples.chinese: 我们缅怀先辈(我們緬懷先輩)。
我们应当追随先辈(我們應當追隨先輩)，传承优秀传统(傳承優秀傳統)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen yīngdāng zhuīsuí xiānbèi, chuánchéng yōuxiù chuántǒng.
examples.english: We should follow our forebears and pass on the excellent traditions.

examples.chinese: 古代文献记载了先辈的智慧(古代文獻記載了先輩的智慧)，激励后人(激勵後人)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔdài wénxiàn jìzǎile xiānbèi de zhìhuì, jīlì hòurén.
examples.english: Ancient texts recorded the wisdom of our forebears, inspiring later generations.
